description: The August incident is under investigation by the police department's internal affairs division and is being reviewed by the Maricopa County Attorney's Office.
title: Phoenix police allegedly beat, repeatedly tased deaf Black man who has cerebral palsy

description: The suits will be used for NASA’s Artemis III mission, marking humankind’s first return to the moon since 1972. It will see the first woman and the first person of color walk on the moon.
title: Prada and Axiom Space reveal modernized NASA spacesuits for the 2026 moon landing

description: If the downward trend holds, this year is expected to be the first since 2020 to see overdose deaths fall below the 100,000 mark. However, Black and Native American communities remain vulnerable.
title: Fentanyl deaths in the U.S. have dropped faster than expected, CDC says

description:
Yahya Sinwar was the mastermind of the October 7th attack on Israel that lead to the war in Gaza. Israel says its forces killed him in an operation in Gaza. We'll hear reaction to his death, more about who he was, and how his killing might affect the future of the war.

For more coverage of all sides of this conflict, go to npr.org/mideastupdates
title: Israel Kills the Leader of Hamas

description: An Arizona judge unsealed Gallego divorce filings Wednesday, rejecting efforts to keep the records hidden. Yet the filings did not offer the October surprise the Democratic Senate candidate's rival, Kari Lake, was hoping it would.
title: Judge unseals Ruben Gallego divorce filing that has hovered over Arizona senate race

description: The grand jury indicted 14-year-old Colt Gray on 55 counts, including murder, aggravated assault and cruelty to children. His father, Colin Gray, faces 29 counts including second-degree murder.
title: A father and son are indicted on murder charges in Georgia high school shooting

description: In western North Carolina, tubing, rafting and kayaking shops are assessing whether the rivers will be safe enough to open by next Summer following the devastating damage from the remnants of Hurricane Helene.
title: Helene’s damage to North Carolina’s Green River affects businesses that depend on it

description: Mitzi Gaynor, the effervescent dancer and actor, starred as Nellie Forbush in the 1958 film of "South Pacific" and appeared in other musicals with Bing Crosby, Frank Sinatra and Gene Kelly.
title: Mitzi Gaynor, star of the big-screen musical ‘South Pacific,’ dies at 93

description: A strain of influenza appears to have disappeared from the planet since COVID. As a result, U.S. flu vaccines have been redesigned.
title: The flu shot is different this year, thanks to COVID

description: The decision has sent shockwaves through the adoption community and angered families still in the process of adopting children from China. We interviewed adoptees in the U.S. to hear their reaction.
title: China ends international adoption. Reactions range from shock to relief

description: It's expected to be a meeting of great political importance — especially for Europe.
title: 'End of an era': Biden heads for a farewell trip to Germany. Here's what to know

description: Radio Campesina has a big goal this year: combat misinformation about elections among Arizona Latinos.
title: From rodeos to radio, inside the Arizona fight against misinformation

description: At a hospital in Kentucky, witnesses say, a man who had been declared dead after a drug overdose was moving and visibly crying as he was prepped for surgery to donate his vital organs. The surgery was stopped and the man is alive three years later.
title: ‘Horrifying’ mistake to harvest organs from a living person averted, witnesses say

description: The 2024 election season is here. As we’re waiting to learn the final results, it can be easy to be duped by false or misleading information. Here are four tips to help you avoid spreading election related misinformation.
title: How to avoid sharing election misinformation
